com.advantage.fileutils

Class VTD_XML

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.advantage.fileutils.VTD_XML

  • public class VTD_XML
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses VTD-XML for reading from an XML file. Use this class if having performance issues with the XML class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VTD_XML()
      Needed for the TestNG unit test in this case.
      VTD_XML(byte[] b)
      Constructor for initializing using bytes

      Notes:
      1) If you have a string, then you can convert it to bytes using the method getBytes()
      VTD_XML(java.lang.String sConfigFile)
      Constructor for initializing using a file

      Gets the ID corresponding to the xpath if it exists else the same xpath is returned.
      java.lang.String[] getNextNode()
      This method navigates to the next node and returns the data in an array using the method extractData()

      Note: If method cannot parse your XML file, then create a new class which inherits this class and override this method & the method extractData as necessary.
      java.lang.String getNodeName(java.lang.String sXpath, java.lang.String sDefault)
      Gets the first nodes name (tag name) for xpath as a String.

      Note:
      If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

      Example:
      int getNodesCount(java.lang.String sXpath)
      Gets count of all Nodes for the given xpath.

      Note: For performance reasons, this result should be stored in a variable instead of calling the function again if needed more than 1 time.
      boolean getNodeValue(java.lang.String sXpath, boolean bDefault)
      Gets the first nodes value for xpath as a boolean.

      Note:
      If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

      Example:
      Sample xml for examples below:
        <test>
          <user>true</user>
          <password>password 1</password>
        </test>

      1) //test returns default value
      2) //test/user returns true
      int getNodeValue(java.lang.String sXpath, int nDefault)
      Gets the first nodes value for xpath as an integer.

      Note:
      If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

      Example:
      Sample xml for examples below:
        <test>
          <user>1</user>
          <password>password 1</password>
        </test>

      1) //test returns default value
      2) //test/user returns 1
      java.lang.String getNodeValue(java.lang.String sXpath, java.lang.String sDefault)
      Gets the first nodes value for xpath as a String.

      Note:
      If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

      Example:
      Sample xml for examples below:
        <test>
          <user>user 1</user>
          <password>password 1</password>
        </test>

      1) //test returns default value
      2) //test/user returns "user 1"
      void initializeForOptimizedParsing(java.lang.String sRootXpath, java.lang.String[] eachNodesXpath)
      Initialization required before use of method getNextNode() which is optimized parsing XML files up to 2GB provided enough memory can be allocated.

      Notes:
      1) On a 32-bit system, the max memory I was able to allocate was 1.6GB.
      2) On a 64-bit system, no memory allocation was need but application must be run from command line.
      void resetXpath()
      Reset the XPath so the XPath Expression can be reused and re-valuated in anther context position
      boolean setXpath(java.lang.String sXpath)
      This method sets the string representing XPath expression
      static void unitTests()
      Method called by testNG to test getAllData and compare to the XML class performance

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • initializeForOptimizedParsing

        public void initializeForOptimizedParsing(java.lang.String sRootXpath,
                                 java.lang.String[] eachNodesXpath)
        Initialization required before use of method getNextNode() which is optimized parsing XML files up to 2GB provided enough memory can be allocated.

        Notes:
        1) On a 32-bit system, the max memory I was able to allocate was 1.6GB.
        2) On a 64-bit system, no memory allocation was need but application must be run from command line. (This may be that eclipse was not running the 64-bit version of Java.)

        Examples:
        1) Given following XML and you want to parse values for var1 & var2
        <rootNode>
          <testcase>
            <var1>1</var1>
            <nested>
              <var2>2</var2>
            </nested>
          </testcase>
          <testcase>
            <var1>abc</var1>
            <nested>
              <var2>def</var2>
            </nested>
          </testcase>
        </rootNode>

        Then, use sRootXpath = "/rootNode/testcase", eachNodesXpath[0] = "/var1", eachNodesXpath[1] = "/nested/var2"
        Parameters:
        sRootXpath - - the root xpath
        eachNodesXpath - - the xpath to each of the nodes to be stored in the array

      • getNodeValue

        public java.lang.String getNodeValue(java.lang.String sXpath,
                            java.lang.String sDefault)
        Gets the first nodes value for xpath as a String.

        Note:
        If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

        Example:
        Sample xml for examples below:
          <test>
            <user>user 1</user>
            <password>password 1</password>
          </test>

        1) //test returns default value
        2) //test/user returns "user 1"
        Parameters:
        sXpath - - xpath to node
        sDefault - - value returned if exception occurs
        Returns:
        String

        Note:

        Parameters:

        sDefault - - value returned if exception occurs
        Returns:

               int nDefault)
        Gets the first nodes value for xpath as an integer.

        Note:
        If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

        Example:
        Sample xml for examples below:
          <test>
            <user>1</user>
            <password>password 1</password>
          </test>

        1) //test returns default value
        2) //test/user returns 1

        nDefault - - value returned if exception occurs
        Returns:

      • getNodeValue

        public boolean getNodeValue(java.lang.String sXpath,
                   boolean bDefault)
        Gets the first nodes value for xpath as a boolean.

        Note:
        If node contains child nodes, then default value is returned.

        Example:
        Sample xml for examples below:
          <test>
            <user>true</user>
            <password>password 1</password>
          </test>

        1) //test returns default value
        2) //test/user returns true
        Parameters:
        sXpath - - xpath to node
        bDefault - - value returned if exception occurs or no match to convert to boolean
        Returns:

      • getNodesCount

        public int getNodesCount(java.lang.String sXpath)
        Gets count of all Nodes for the given xpath.

        Note: For performance reasons, this result should be stored in a variable instead of calling the function again if needed more than 1 time. As the processing time would be n instead of n*n.
        Parameters:
        sXpath - - xpath for the nodes to count
        Returns:

      • getAllData

        public java.lang.String[][] getAllData(java.lang.String sRootXpath,
                              java.lang.String[] sEachNode)
        Reads XML and puts the data into an array. Example, sRootXpath = "/root/testdata" & sEachNode = {"var1","var2"} => Get data for "/root/testdata[i]/var1" & "/root/testdata[i]/var2" where i is for each "/root/testdata" node found.
        Parameters:
        sRootXpath - - The root node that contains multiple sets of data
        sEachNode - - All nodes that make up a specific set of data
        Returns:
        String[][] with all data

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String sXpath,
                            java.lang.String sAttribute)
        Gets the attribute to the specified node.
        Note: If xpath returns multiple nodes, only the first is checked for the attribute.
        Parameters:
        sXpath - - xpath to node
        sAttribute - - attribute to find
        Returns:
        null if cannot find

      • getIDfromXpath

        public java.lang.String getIDfromXpath(java.lang.String sXpath)
        Gets the ID corresponding to the xpath if it exists else the same xpath is returned.
        Parameters:
        sXpath -
        Returns:
        if ID exists it is returned else sXpath

      • getNextNode

        public java.lang.String[] getNextNode()
        This method navigates to the next node and returns the data in an array using the method extractData()

        Note: If method cannot parse your XML file, then create a new class which inherits this class and override this method & the method extractData as necessary. (This may be the case if you need data from attributes.)
        Returns:
        null if no more data else array of strings

      • unitTests

        public static void unitTests()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Method called by testNG to test getAllData and compare to the XML class performance
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setXpath

        public boolean setXpath(java.lang.String sXpath)
        This method sets the string representing XPath expression
        Parameters:
        sXpath - as String
        Returns:
        false in case of any error else true

      • resetXpath

        public void resetXpath()
        Reset the XPath so the XPath Expression can be reused and re-valuated in anther context position

      • getCurrentNodeName

        public java.lang.String getCurrentNodeName()
        Method to get the current node name i.e. tag name
        This method needs to be called after setting xpath using setXpath method.
        Returns:
        - Name of the node or tag.

      • getCurrentNodeValue

        public java.lang.String getCurrentNodeValue()
        Method to get the current node value i.e. tag name
        This method needs to be called after setting xpath using setXpath method.
        Returns:
        - Value of the node or tag.
